title: Long life lithium batteries with stabilized electrodes

classifications.description: Liquid materials characterised by the additives
Liquid materials characterised by the solutes

Selection of substances as active materials, active masses, active liquids of inorganic oxides or hydroxides of nickel, cobalt or iron of mixed oxides or hydroxides containing iron, cobalt or nickel for inserting or intercalating light metals, e.g. LiNiO2, LiCoO2 or LiCoOxFy
Cells with non-aqueous electrolyte with organic electrolyte characterised by the electrolyte by the solute

abstract: The present invention relates to non-aqueous electrolytes having stabilization additives and electrochemical devices containing the same. Thus the present invention provides electrolytes containing an alkali metal salt, a polar aprotic solvent, a first additive that is a substituted or unsubstituted organoamine, substituted or unsubstituted alkane, substituted or unsubstituted alkene, or substituted or unsubstituted aryl compound, and/or a second additive that is a metal(chelato)borate. When used in electrochemical devices with, e.g., lithium manganese oxide spinel electrodes, the new electrolytes provide batteries with improved calendar and cycle life.
claims:
1. A non-aqueous electrolyte comprising: 
an alkali metal salt;  a polar aprotic solvent;  a first additive that is a substituted or unsubstituted organoamine, a substituted or unsubstituted alkane, a substituted or unsubstituted alkene, a substituted or unsubstituted aryl compound, or a mixture of any two or more thereof; and  a second additive that is a metal(chelato)borate.

2. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 1 wherein the first additive is pyridazine, vinyl pyridazine, quinoline, vinyl quinoline, pyridine, vinyl pyridine, indole, vinyl indole, triethanolamine, 1,3-dimethyl butadiene, butadiene, vinyl ethylene carbonate, vinyl carbonate, imidazole, vinyl imidazole, piperidine, vinyl piperidine, pyrimidine, vinyl pyrimidine, pyrazine, vinyl pyrazine, isoquinoline, vinyl isoquinoline, quinoxaline, vinyl quinoxaline, biphenyl, 1,2-diphenyl ether, 1,2-diphenylethane, o-terphenyl, N-methyl pyrrole, naphthalene, or a mixture of any two or more thereof.
3. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 1 wherein the first additive is N-methyl pyrrole, 2-vinyl pyridine, 4-vinyl pyridine, triethanolamine, or biphenyl.
4. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 1 wherein the second additive is a lithium(chelato)borate.
5. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 1 wherein the second additive is Li[(C2O4)2B] or Li(C2O4)BF2.
6. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 5 wherein the first additive is N-methyl pyrrole, 2-vinyl pyridine, 4-vinyl pyridine, triethanolamine or biphenyl.
7. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 1 wherein the alkali metal salt is a lithium salt.

8. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 1 wherein the alkali metal salt is LiClO4, LiBF4, LiAsF6, LiPF6, LiCF3SO3, Li(CF3SO2)2N, Li(CF3SO2)3C, LiN(SO2C2F5)2, lithium alkyl fluorophosphates, or a mixture of any two or more thereof.

9. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 1 wherein the polar aprotic solvent is ethylene carbonate, propylene carbonate, dimethyl carbonate, diethyl carbonate, ethyl methyl carbonate, dimethyl ether, gamma butyrolactone, or a mixture of any two or more thereof.

10. A non-aqueous electrolyte comprising: 
an alkali metal salt;  a polar aprotic solvent; and  a first additive that is a substituted or unsubstituted unsaturated organoamine.

11. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 10 wherein the first additive is vinyl pyridazine, vinyl quinoline, vinyl pyridine, vinyl indole, vinyl imidazole, vinyl piperidine, vinyl pyrimidine, vinyl pyrazine, vinyl isoquinoline, vinyl quinoxaline, or a mixture of any two or more thereof.
12. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 10 wherein the first additive is vinyl pyridine.
13. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 12 wherein the first additive is 2- or 4-vinyl pyridine.
14. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 10 further comprising a second additive that is Li[(C2O4)2B] or Li(C2O4)BF2.
15. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 10 wherein the alkali metal salt is a lithium salt.

16. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 10 wherein the alkali metal salt is LiClO4, LiBF4, LiAsF6, LiPF6, LiCF3SO3, Li(CF3SO2)2N, Li(CF3SO2)3C, LiN(SO2C2F5)2, lithium alkyl fluorophosphates, or a mixture of any two or more thereof.

17. A non-aqueous electrolyte comprising: 
an alkali metal salt other than Li[(C2O4)2B];  a polar aprotic solvent; and  an additive that is a metal(chelato)borate.
18. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 17 wherein the additive is a lithium (chelato)borate.
19. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 17 wherein the additive is Li[(C2O4)2B] or Li(C2O4)BF2.
20. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 17, wherein the additive is present in an amount of about 0.0005 to about 10 wt %.
21. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 17, wherein the additive is present in an amount of about 0.0005 to about 2 wt %.
22. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 17 wherein the alkali metal salt is a lithium salt.

23. The non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 17 wherein the alkali metal salt is LiClO4, LiBF4, LiAsF6, LiPF6, LiCF3SO3, Li(CF3SO2)2N, Li(CF3SO2)3C, LiN(SO2C2F5)2, lithium alkyl fluorophosphates, or a mixture of any two or more thereof.

24. An electrochemical device comprising: 
a cathode;  an anode; and  an electrolyte of claim 1.

25. The electrochemical device of claim 24 wherein the device is a lithium secondary battery; the cathode is a lithium metal oxide cathode; the anode is a carbon or lithium metal anode; and the anode and cathode are separated from each other by a porous separator

26. The electrochemical device of claim 25 wherein the cathode comprises LiCoO2, LiNiO2, LiNi1−xCoyMetzO2, LiMn0.5Ni0.5O2, LiMn0.3Co0.3Ni0.3O2, LiFePO4, LiMn2O4, LiFeO2, LiMet0.5Mn1.5O4, vanadium oxide, or mixtures of any two or more thereof, wherein Met is Al, Mg, Ti, B, Ga, Si, Ni, or Co, and wherein 0<x<0.3, 0<y<0.5, and 0<z<0.5.

27. The electrochemical device of claim 25 wherein the cathode comprises a spinel manganese oxide with a formula of Li1+xMn2−zMetyO4−mXn, wherein Met is Al, Mg, Ti, B, Ga, Si, Ni, or Co, and X is S or F, and wherein 0<x<0.3, 0<y<0.5, 0<z<0.5, 0<m<0.5 and 0<n<0.5.

28. The electrochemical device of claim 25 wherein the anode comprises graphite, carbon, Li4Ti5O12, tin alloys, silica alloys, intermetallic compounds, lithium metal, or mixtures of any two or more thereof.
29. The electrochemical device according to claim 25 wherein the first additive and the second additive are independently present in an amount from about 0.0005 to about 30 wt %.
30. The electrochemical device according to claim 25 wherein the first additive is present in an amount from about 0.001 to about 10 wt %.
31. The electrochemical device of claim 25 wherein the first additive is present in an amount of about 0.01 to 2 wt %.
32. The electrochemical device of claim 25 wherein the second additive is present in an amount of about 0.001 to about 2 wt %.

33. An electrochemical device comprising: 
a cathode;  an anode; and  an electrolyte of claim 10.

34. An electrochemical device comprising: 
a cathode;  an anode; and  an electrolyte of claim 18.

35. A method of making the non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 1, the method comprising combining 
an alkali metal salt;  a polar aprotic solvent;  a first additive that is a substituted or unsubstituted organoamine, a substituted or unsubstituted alkene, or a substituted or unsubstituted aryl compound; and  a second additive that is a metal(chelato)borate.

36. A method of making the non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 10, the method comprising combining 
an alkali metal salt;  a polar aprotic solvent; and  a first additive that is a substituted or unsubstituted unsaturated organoamine.

37. A method of making the non-aqueous electrolyte of claim 17, the method comprising combining 
an alkali metal salt other than Li[(C2O4)2B];  a polar aprotic solvent; and  an additive that is a metal(chelato)borate.
